body: I’m planning to learn a new #language next year, but I can’t decide which one! #languagelearning #goals
question: Which language should I learn?

comments.body: Spanish for sure! It’s super practical, and you can use it in so many places around the world. Plus, it’s not too difficult to learn.
@67676 I’ve heard that about Spanish! It does seem like a useful language, especially for traveling around the Americas.
French all the way! It’s such a beautiful language, and if you ever visit France or parts of Africa, it’ll come in handy.
@78787 French does have a certain elegance to it! I’d love to visit Paris someday, so it would be great to know the language.
Go for Japanese! It’s challenging but so rewarding. Plus, if you’re into Japanese culture or anime, it’s awesome to understand the language.
@89898 That’s tempting! I’ve always wanted to visit Japan, and learning Japanese would make the experience even better.
Italian! It’s the language of art, music, and food. Plus, Italy is such a beautiful country, and speaking the language makes the experience so much richer.
@45454 Italian would be fun! I’d love to learn the language before visiting Rome or Florence one day. The food alone is reason enough to go!
Honestly, any of these languages would be amazing! But I voted for Spanish—so many people speak it, and you’ll find it useful in everyday life.
@34343 That’s true! Spanish seems like the most practical option, especially if I want to use it regularly.
